title: Acokanthera rotundata
text: Acokanthera rotundata (commonly known as round-leaved poison-bush) is a plant in the family <a href="Apocynaceae">Apocynaceae</a>. It grows as a shrub or small tree, with fragrant flowers featuring a white <a href="Corolla%20%28flower%29">corolla</a>, often pink to red on the corolla tube. The fruit is red to purple when ripe. Its habitat is in rocky areas of dry woodland. "Acokanthera rotundata" is native to <a href="Zimbabwe">Zimbabwe</a>, <a href="Eswatini">Eswatini</a> and <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>.
